page.title: 01Haughley and Wetherden
page.content: Pleasantly undulating countryside consisting in the main of land cultivated for the production of cereal crops. Buildings generally are typically Suffolk and there are many extremely attractive cottages and houses, quite a few with thatched roofs and timbered frames. It is a pleasant area to live in, both villages of Haughley and Wetherden have been passed by modern Motorways. Haughley is the largest of the two villages having an approximate population of 1800. Wetherden is much smaller with a population of 420. Many people have been attracted to the villages seeking quiet retirement, yet within easy reach of modern shops, services and entertainment in the adjacent towns. A small number of the population are employed in
